Document.Focus: Weight gain after quitting smoking: What to do

QAPair.Question: What is (are) Weight gain after quitting smoking: What to do ?
QAPair.Answer: Many people gain weight when they quit smoking cigarettes. On average, people gain 5 to 10 pounds (2.25 to 4.5 kilograms) in the months after they give up smoking. You may put off quitting if you are worried about adding extra weight. But not smoking is one of the best things you can do for your health. Fortunately, there are things you can do to keep your weight under control when you quit.
